intro: Oreoherzogia alpina var. cordata, commonly known as the Alpine oreoherzogia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer.
